bo¶

class jaxbo.bo.BOBE(loglikelihood=None, n_cobaya_init=4, n_sobol_init=32, miniters=200, maxiters=1500, max_gp_size=1200, resume=False, resume_file=None, save=True, fit_step=10, update_mc_step=10, ns_step=10, num_hmc_warmup=512, num_hmc_samples=512, mc_points_size=64, mc_points_method='NUTS', lengthscale_priors='DSLP', use_svm=True, svm_use_size=300, svm_update_step=5, logz_threshold=1.0, minus_inf=-100000.0)¶

Bases: object

check_convergence(step, logz_dict, threshold=2.0)¶

Check if the nested sampling has converged.

run()¶

Run the iterative Bayesian Optimization loop.

Parameters:

None

Returns:

  • gp (GP object) -- The fitted GP object.

  • ns_samples (Nested sampling samples) -- The samples from the nested sampling run. This is a dictionary with the following keys ['x','weights'].

  • logz_dict (dict) -- The logz dictionary from the nested sampling run. This contains the upper and lower bounds of the logz.

fb_gp¶

class jaxbo.fb_gp.SAAS_FBGP(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', vmap_size=8, sample_lengthscales=None, sample_outputscales=None, warmup_steps=512, num_samples=512, thinning=32, dense_mass=False, max_tree_depth=6, num_chains=1, min_lengthscale=0.01, max_lengthscale=100.0)¶

Bases: GP

Main class for the Fully Bayesian GP.

Parameters:

  • train_x (jnp.ndarray) -- Training inputs, size (N x D)

  • train_y (jnp.ndarray) -- Objective function values at training points size (N x 1)

  • standardise_y (bool) -- Standardise the output values to have zero mean and unit variance, default True

  • noise (float) -- Noise parameter to add to the diagonal of the kernel, default 1e-8

  • kernel (str) -- Kernel to use, either "rbf" or "matern"

  • vmap_size (int) -- Batch size for vmap, useful for managing memory, default 8

  • sample_lengthscales (jnp.ndarray) -- Pre-sampled lengthscales, default None

  • sample_outputscales (jnp.ndarray) -- Pre-sampled output scales, default None

  • warmup_steps (int) -- Number of warmup steps for NUTS, default 256

  • num_samples (int) -- Number of samples to draw from the posterior, default 256

  • thinning (int) -- Thinning factor for the MCMC samples, default 16

  • dense_mass (bool) -- Use dense mass matrix for NUTS, default True

  • max_tree_depth (int) -- Maximum tree depth for NUTS, default 6

  • num_chains (int) -- Number of chains to run in parallel, default 1

  • min_lengthscale (float) -- Minimum lengthscale value, default 1e-3

  • max_lengthscale (float) -- Maximum lengthscale value, default 1e2

add(new_x, new_y)¶

Updates the GP with new training points.

fantasy_var(x_new, mc_points)¶

Returns the MAP fantasy variance of the GP at x_new using the MAP hyperparameters

fantasy_var_bayes(x_new, mc_points)¶

Returns the fantasy variance of the GP at x_new using the hyperparameter samples

predict(x)¶

Returns the mean and variance of the unstandardised GP posterior at x, e.g for EI

Parameters:

x (jnp.ndarray) -- Input points, size (M x D)

predict_mean(x)¶

Predicts the mean of the GP at x and unstandardizes it

predict_var(x)¶

Predicts the variance of the GP at x and unstandardizes it

save(save_file='saas_fbgp')¶

Saves the GP model as an npz file - training inputs, training outputs, lengthscales and output scales. Note that the training outputs are unstandardized.

Parameters:

save_file (str) -- File name to save the GP model

class jaxbo.fb_gp.SVM_SAAS_FBGP(support_vectors, dual_coef, intercept, gamma_eff, train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', vmap_size=8, sample_lengthscales=None, sample_outputscales=None, warmup_steps=256, num_samples=256, thinning=32, dense_mass=False, max_tree_depth=6, num_chains=1, min_lengthscale=0.01, max_lengthscale=100.0)¶

Bases: SAAS_FBGP

fit(rng_key, progbar=True, verbose=False)¶

Fits the GP using maximum likelihood hyperparameters

predict_mean(x)¶

Predicts the mean of the GP at x and unstandardizes it if x is within the boundary of the SVM, else returns -inf

predict_var(x)¶

Predicts the variance of the GP at x and unstandardizes it if x is within the boundary of the SVM, else returns noise flooer

tree_flatten()¶

Returns the flattened tree of the GP object

jaxbo.fb_gp.dist_sq(x, y)¶

Compute squared Euclidean distance between two points x, y. If x is n1 x d and y is n2 x d returns a n1 x n2 matrix of distancess.

jaxbo.fb_gp.sample_GP_NUTS(gp, rng_key, warmup_steps=512, num_samples=512, progress_bar=True, thinning=2, verbose=False, init_from_max=True)¶

Obtain samples from the posterior represented by the GP mean as the logprob

Parameters:

  • gp (saas_fbgp) -- The GP object

  • rng_key (jnp.ndarray) -- Random key

  • warmup_steps (int) -- Number of warmup steps for NUTS, default 512

  • num_samples (int) -- Number of samples to draw from the posterior, default 512

  • progress_bar (bool) -- If True, shows a progress bar, default True

  • thinning (int) -- Thinning factor for the MCMC samples, default 2

  • verbose (bool) -- If True, prints the MCMC summary, default False

  • init_params (dict) -- Initial parameters for the MCMC, default None

gp¶

class jaxbo.gp.DSLP_GP(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', optimizer='adam', outputscale_bounds=[-4, 4], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2])¶

Bases: GP

fantasy_var(x_new, mc_points)¶

Computes the variance of the GP at the mc_points assuming x_new is added to the training set

fit(lr=0.01, maxiter=250, n_restarts=2)¶

Fits the GP using maximum likelihood hyperparameters with the optax adam optimizer. Starts from current hyperparameters.

Parameters:

  • lr (float) -- The learning rate for the optax optimizer. Default is 1e-2.

  • maxiter (int) -- The maximum number of iterations for the optax optimizer. Default is 250.

  • n_restarts (int) -- The number of restarts for the optax optimizer. Default is 2.

predict(x)¶

Predicts the mean and variance of the GP at x but does not unstandardize it

predict_mean(x)¶

Predicts the mean of the GP at x and unstandardizes it

predict_var(x)¶

Predicts the variance of the GP at x and unstandardizes it

tree_flatten()¶
classmethod tree_unflatten(aux_data, leaves)¶
update(new_x, new_y, refit=True, lr=0.01, maxiter=200, n_restarts=4)¶

Updates the GP with new training points and refits the GP if refit is True.

Parameters:

  • refit (bool) -- Whether to refit the GP hyperparameters. Default is True.

  • lr (float) -- The learning rate for the optax optimizer. Default is 1e-2.

  • maxiter (int) -- The maximum number of iterations for the optax optimizer. Default is 250.

  • n_restarts (int) -- The number of restarts for the optax optimizer. Default is 2.

Returns:

repeat -- Whether the point new_x, new_y already exists in the training set.

Return type:

bool

jaxbo.gp.sample_GP_NUTS(gp, rng_key, warmup_steps=512, num_samples=512, progress_bar=True, thinning=8, verbose=False, init_params=None, temp=1.0)¶

Obtain samples from the posterior represented by the GP mean as the logprob.

Parameters:

  • gp (saas_fbgp) -- The GP object

  • rng_key (jnp.ndarray) -- Random key

  • warmup_steps (int) -- Number of warmup steps for NUTS, default 512

  • num_samples (int) -- Number of samples to draw from the posterior, default 512

  • progress_bar (bool) -- If True, shows a progress bar, default True

  • thinning (int) -- Thinning factor for the MCMC samples, default 2

  • verbose (bool) -- If True, prints the MCMC summary, default False

  • init_params (dict) -- Initial parameters for the MCMC, default None

  • temp (float) -- Temperature parameter for the logprob, default 1.0

nested_sampler¶

jaxbo.nested_sampler.compute_integrals(logl=None, logvol=None, reweight=None)¶
jaxbo.nested_sampler.nested_sampling_Dy(gp, ndim=1, dlogz=0.2, dynamic=True, logz_std=True, maxcall=None, boost_maxcall=1, progress=True, equal_weights=False)¶

Nested Sampling using Dynesty

Parameters:

  • gp (saas_fbgp) -- Gaussian Process model

  • ndim (int) -- Number of dimensions

  • dlogz (float) -- Log evidence goal

  • dynamic (bool) -- Use dynamic nested sampling, see Dynesty documentation for more details

  • logz_std (bool) -- Compute the upper and lower bounds on logZ using the GP uncertainty

  • maxcall (int) -- Maximum number of function calls

  • boost_maxcall (int) -- Boost the maximum number of function calls

  • progress (bool) -- Print progress of the nested sampling run

Return type:

tuple[ndarray, Dict]

Returns:

  • samples (ndarray) -- Equally weighted samples from the nested sampler

  • logz_dict (dict) -- Dictionary containing the mean, upper and lower bounds on logZ and the logZ error from the nested sampler

jaxbo.nested_sampler.nested_sampling_jaxns(gp, ndim=1, dlogZ=0.1, evidence_uncert=0.1, logz_std=True, maxcall=1000000.0, boost_maxcall=1, batch_size=25, parameter_estimation=False, difficult_model=False, equal_weights=False)¶

Nested Sampling using JaxNS

Parameters:

  • gp (saas_fbgp) -- Gaussian Process model

  • ndim (int) -- Number of dimensions

  • dlogz (float) -- Log evidence goal

  • logz_std (bool) -- Compute the upper and lower bounds on logZ using the GP uncertainty

  • maxcall (int) -- Maximum number of function calls

  • boost_maxcall (int) -- Boost the maximum number of function calls

  • batch_size (int) -- Batch size for computing the upper and lower bounds on logZ, used to manage memory

  • parameter_estimation (bool) -- Jaxns settings to get robust parameter estimation, see Jaxns documentation for more details

  • difficult_model (bool) -- Jaxns settings to handle difficult models, see Jaxns documentation for more details

Returns:

  • samples (ndarray) -- Equally weighted samples from the nested sampler

  • logz_dict (dict) -- Dictionary containing the mean, upper and lower bounds on logZ and the logZ error from the nested sampler

jaxbo.nested_sampler.prior_transform(x)¶
jaxbo.nested_sampler.renormalise_log_weights(log_weights)¶

svm_gp¶

class jaxbo.svm_gp.SVM_GP(support_vectors=None, dual_coef=None, intercept=None, gamma_eff=None, svm_use_size=400, svm_update_step=5, minus_inf=-100000.0, svm_threshold=250, gp_threshold=10000, train_x=None, train_y=None, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', optimizer='adam', outputscale_bounds=[-4, 4], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], lengthscale_priors='DSLP')¶

Bases: object

fantasy_var(x_new, mc_points)¶

Computes the variance of the GP at the mc_points assuming x_new is added to the training set

fit(lr=0.01, maxiter=250, n_restarts=2)¶

Fits the GP using maximum likelihood hyperparameters with the optax adam optimizer

predict_mean(x)¶

Predicts the mean of the GP at x and unstandardizes it if x is within the boundary of the SVM, else returns -inf

predict_var(x)¶

Predicts the variance of the GP at x and unstandardizes it if x is within the boundary of the SVM, else returns 0.

prune()¶

Discards points from the GP which have extremely low likelihood values. TO BE IMPLEMENTED

save(outfile='gp')¶

Saves the GP to a file

Parameters:

outfile (str) -- The name of the file to save the GP to. Default is 'gp'.

svm_volume_estimate(seed=0, n_samples=10000)¶

Returns an estimate of the volume of the SVM decision boundary using Monte Carlo sampling.

Parameters:

  • seed (int) -- The random seed for the Monte Carlo sampling. Default is 0.

  • n_samples (int) -- The number of samples to use for the Monte Carlo sampling. Default is 10000.

Returns:

  • vol (float) -- The estimated volume of the SVM decision boundary.

  • err (float) -- The estimated error of the volume estimate.

update(new_x, new_y, refit=True, lr=0.01, maxiter=250, n_restarts=2)¶

Updates the SVM training set and the GP with new training points and refits the GP if refit is True

Parameters:

  • new_x (JAX array of new training points, shape (n_samples, n_features)) -- The new training points for the GP.

  • new_y (JAX array of new training values, shape (n_samples,1)) -- The new training values for the GP.

  • refit (bool) -- Whether to refit the GP hyperparameters. Default is True.

  • lr (float) -- The learning rate for the optax optimizer. Default is 1e-2.

  • maxiter (int) -- The maximum number of iterations for the optax optimizer. Default is 250.

  • n_restarts (int) -- The number of restarts for the optax optimizer. Default is 2.

Returns:

repeat -- Whether the point new_x, new_y already exists in the training set.

Return type:

bool

update_svm()¶

Updates the SVM with the new training points

jaxbo.svm_gp.svm_predict(x, support_vectors, dual_coef, intercept, gamma)¶

Compute the decision function for SVM with RBF kernel.

Parameters:

  • x -- Input data point, shape (n_features,)

  • support_vectors -- JAX array of support vectors, shape (n_sv, n_features)

  • dual_coef -- JAX array of dual coefficients, shape (n_sv,)

  • intercept -- Scalar bias term.

  • gamma -- RBF kernel gamma parameter.

Returns:

Decision function value (scalar). Sign of this value gives the predicted class.

jaxbo.svm_gp.svm_predict_batch(x, support_vectors, dual_coef, intercept, gamma)¶

Compute the decision function for SVM with RBF kernel for a batch of inputs.

jaxbo.svm_gp.train_svm(x, y, gamma='scale', C=10000000.0)¶

Train the SVM on the data.
